trustfund: TF034155-LATIN AMERICA REGION - HEATLH PROJECTS,TF022915-HEALTH AND NUTRITION

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Health Project will: (a)
            reduce the incidence of malnutrition from an estimated 40
            percent at present to about 30 percent among young children,
            breast-feeding and pregnant women in the poorest 28
            districts of Panama; (b) increase the coverage of water
            supply and basic sanitation in all of Panama's rural
            areas from about 62 to 80 percent and from about 72 to 88
            percent respectively; (c) train new and existing Community
            Water Boards to improve their capacity to operate and
            maintain systems under their responsibility; and (d)
            strengthen the institutional capacity of: the Subdirectorate
            General of Environmental Health of the Ministry of Health,
            Subdirectorate General of Health Services, Project
            Administration Unit, and the Ministry of Planning and
            Economic Policy. The Project supports the Government of
            Panama's poverty alleviation strategy as it (a) targets
            nutrition interventions in the poorest districts; (b)
            contributes to human resource development by improving
            access to basic and preventive health services; (c) involves
            the community in the design and execution of subprojects and
            makes them fully responsible for their operation and
            maintenance; and (d) makes the fullest use of
            nongovernmental organizations, private sector and community
            resources. Thus, the project consists of three components:
            nutrition, rural water supply and sanitation, and
            institutional strengthening.
